alert.note: Alert for DuPage; Grundy; Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 11:09AM CST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by steady rainfall over frozen soil expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following counties, Cook, DuPage, Grundy, Kendall and Will. * WHEN...Until 215 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas including ditches, farm fields, underpasses, and the shoulders of roadways and interstates. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1106 AM CST, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated steady rain. - Up to one inch of rain has fallen so far, and an additional half inch of rain is possible by 1 PM CST. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chicago, Aurora, Joliet, Naperville, Cicero, Bolingbrook, Orland Park, Tinley Park, Oak Lawn, Berwyn, Oak Park, Downers Grove, Romeoville, Plainfield, Calumet City, Woodridge, Oswego, Chicago Heights, Midway Airport and Chicago Lawn. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
